company.name: American United
company.business_description: American United is a financial institution that receives consumer reports and personal financial information from credit agencies. It maintains consumer data including names, addresses, credit reports, and information derived from consumer reports.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1), Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 53(b); Section 621 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ('FCRA'), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s; Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. §§ 314

complaint.factual_background: American United, a mortgage company and financial institution, failed to implement reasonable security measures to protect consumers' personal information. The company failed to implement reasonable procedures for disposing of consumer reports and personal information, and left documents containing consumers' personal information in an unsecured dumpster adjacent to their office, creating risk of unauthorized access. The company also failed to provide customers with required privacy notices.

representations_made.description: Claimed to implement reasonable security measures to protect against unauthorized access to consumers' personal information
representations_made.quoted_text: reasonable measures to protect against unauthorized access to or use

counts.title: Failure to Implement Safeguards Rule
counts.representation: Required to develop, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program with administrative, technical, and physical safeguards
counts.fact: Failed to develop, implement, or maintain a comprehensive security program as required by the Safeguards Rule
counts.conclusion: Defendant's practices violated the Safeguards Rule

counts.title: Failure to Comply with Privacy Rule
counts.representation: Required to provide customers with a copy of its privacy policy
counts.fact: Failed to provide customers with a copy of its privacy policy in violation of 16 CFR § 313

counts.title: Failure to Comply with Disposal Rule
counts.representation: Required to implement reasonable procedures for disposing of consumer reports and take reasonable actions when disposing such information
counts.fact: Failed to implement reasonable disposal procedures, including failing to burn, pulverize, or shred consumer reports so they could not be practicably read or reconstructed; left documents in unsecured dumpster

source_files.complaint: 12.07, American United Mortgage Company., United States of America Complaint.pdf
source_files.order: 12.07, American United Mortgage Company., United States of America Order.pdf
